intro: Baphia leptostemma, commonly known as the slender-stemmed baphia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture. Baphia leptostemma is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
